content: Is there a preferred browser for Scenario Builder? I've tried on Safari, Chrome and FireFox and when I open Scenario Builder, the top part of the screen is not viewable so you can't get to the New Scenario.
Hi Melva, have you tried increasing the screen resolution? In chrome it's <command><minus> ...(should work in all those browsers...)

I tried changing the resolution, but it just makes everything bigger and doesn’t change the issue that the top row (with the Scenario Builder - Hide Selector - Import resource - etc labels) is over top of the bottom part of the screen. I only see “local scenarios” and 2 bullets below. If I try to grab the bottom part and pull down, I can see “New Scenario” but there is no way to click on it.

OK - think I've got it. Are you logged in? It appears that if you're not then the top navbar is too big! I will fix, but can you confirm that that is the issue?

cheers...
I am logged in and still the same issue.
dang. OK. can you do a screen dump using chrome and email to me (or send via the chat)..
what computer and screen size are you using?
Oh - and I assume this is a new issue, as you've use CF in the past...
OK - have modified the navbar a bit, moving some less used functions to a menu rather than a link (the cog icon to the right). Does that help?
What ever you did worked David! Thanks!
Good-oh! Let me know if you have any further issues...
